channel.title: [PI] Farming Patches [317]
channel.description: I've noticed that when I added a tree patch where you put in the herb and the herb pops up grown, it grows over in catherby, which is where the other farming patch is. (I copied the other farming patch's ID.)

item.title: [PI] Farming Patches [317]
item.dc:creator: @Get_Blitz Get Blitz
item.description:
@Get_Blitz wrote:

[quote=“Gouki, post:6, topic:404609”][quote author=Get Blitz link=topic=501626.msg3674795#msg3674795 date=1311184437]
Go into Farming.java

Search for

public void updateHerbPatch()

You should see something like

c.getPA().object(PATCH_HERBS,2344,3342,-1,10);

Change those coords to you new patch Coords. Make sure they are the exact same coords.
[/quote]

Doing it like that means you are still using the same farming patch.[/quote]

Well then you can add two of those lines i guess?

something like this maybe

c.getPA().object(PATCH_HERBS,CoordsX,CoordsY,-1,10 || c.getPA().object(PATCH_HERBS,CoordsX,CoordsY,-1,10);

Read full topic

You should see something like

item.title: [PI] Farming Patches [317]
item.dc:creator: @Gouki Gouki
item.description:
@Gouki wrote:

I’m having the same problem.
Right now , I have 2 farming patches, the custom one and the catherby one.
When i use seed on catherby, all is fine, however, when i use seed on my custom patch, all is fine until I leave the area, then when i return, patch becomes bush again. Also, when i use the seed on my custom patch, it also adds it to catherby for some reason, it’s like I can pick a few in my custom patch, then proceed to tele to catherby and pick the rest there.

What I need is how to make it so:

  1. It does not create a herb patch in catherby and
  2. The custom herbs stay if I teleport away then return to pick more, like the original catherby patch.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Farming Patches [317]
item.dc:creator: @HonorScape HonorScape
item.description:
@HonorScape wrote:

I found this. What should I do with it? I’ve tried adding that same thing with the co-ordinates of the farming patch I want it to be at, but it didn’t work. And also, I want that farming patch in Catherby to work too, along with the one I want to add.

loadCustomSpawns(c); if (c.distanceToPoint(2813, 3463) <= 60) { c.getFarming().updateHerbPatch(); } }

Read full topic

item.description:
@Xata27 wrote:

Try switching the two IDs then, if that doesn’t work then your ID list might be screwed up.
